ARABIC: كَانُوا۟ قَلِيلًا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The part of the night they spent asleep was small
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They slept little in the night,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: they used to sleep but little by night,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They slept very little during the night
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They used to sleep only a little during the night.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They used to sleep but little by night.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They used to sleep but little in the night.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Little of the night would they slumber,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They used to sleep but little of the night,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Little of the night they were wont to slumber.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They used to sleep a little during the night,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They were in the habit of sleeping but little by night,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They used to sleep but little by night [invoking their Lord (Allah) and praying, with fear and hope].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They slept but a little at night,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They used to sleep a little at night.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They used to sleep but little of the night,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:17] Little of the night did they use to sleep (mā is extra; yahja‘ūna is the predicate of kānū; qalīlan, ‘little’, is an adverb), in other words, they used to sleep for a small portion of the night and perform prayers during most of it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They used to sleep but little of the night) He says: they hardly slept at night,
